aiAnalysisNote.title: AI Analysis
aiAnalysisNote.description: Our AI will analyze your cycle progress, fatigue levels, and training patterns to recommend the best timing for this change.

push_pull_legs.name: Push/Pull/Legs
push_pull_legs.description: 6-day cycle with 2x frequency per muscle. Balanced volume and recovery.
push_pull_legs.structure: Day 1: Push (Chest, Shoulders, Triceps) ‚Ä¢ Day 2: Pull (Back, Biceps) ‚Ä¢ Day 3: Legs ‚Ä¢ Day 4: Push ‚Ä¢ Day 5: Pull ‚Ä¢ Day 6: Legs
push_pull_legs.bestFor: Intermediate to advanced lifters seeking balanced frequency and volume. Ideal for muscle growth and strength gains.

upper_lower.name: Upper/Lower
upper_lower.description: 4-day cycle with 2x frequency. Higher volume per session, time-efficient.
upper_lower.structure: Day 1: Upper Body ‚Ä¢ Day 2: Lower Body ‚Ä¢ Day 3: Upper Body ‚Ä¢ Day 4: Lower Body
upper_lower.bestFor: All experience levels. Perfect for those with limited training days but seeking high frequency.

full_body.name: Full Body
full_body.description: 3-day cycle with 3x frequency. Maximum frequency, excellent for beginners.
full_body.structure: Day 1: Full Body (all major muscles) ‚Ä¢ Day 2: Full Body ‚Ä¢ Day 3: Full Body
full_body.bestFor: Beginners or those with limited time. Maximizes training frequency with minimal commitment.
cons: Lower volume per muscle per session

bro_split.name: Bro Split
bro_split.description: 5-day cycle with 1x frequency. Very high volume per session, for advanced lifters.
bro_split.structure: Day 1: Chest ‚Ä¢ Day 2: Back ‚Ä¢ Day 3: Shoulders ‚Ä¢ Day 4: Arms ‚Ä¢ Day 5: Legs
bro_split.bestFor: Advanced lifters who thrive on high volume and enjoy dedicated muscle days.

weak_point_focus.name: Weak Point Focus
weak_point_focus.description: Custom cycle emphasizing a specific muscle group with 50% more volume.
weak_point_focus.structure: Customized based on selected weak point muscle. Increased frequency and volume for target area.
weak_point_focus.bestFor: Experienced lifters addressing specific muscle imbalances or lagging body parts.

split.title: Choose Your Training Split
split.description: Select how you want to organize your training week. This determines how muscle groups are distributed across workouts.

push_pull_legs.name: Push / Pull / Legs
push_pull_legs.description: Separate pushing, pulling, and leg movements across different days. Ideal for balanced development and high frequency.

upper_lower.name: Upper / Lower
upper_lower.description: Alternate between upper body and lower body workouts. Great for strength and balanced recovery.

full_body.name: Full Body
full_body.description: Train all major muscle groups each session. Perfect for beginners or those with limited training days.

custom.name: Custom Split
custom.description: Let the AI create a customized split based on your preferences and training approach.

bro_split.name: Bro Split
bro_split.description: Classic bodybuilding split with dedicated days for chest, back, shoulders, arms, and legs. Each body part trained with A/B variations for optimal development.

weak_point_focus.name: Weak Point Focus
weak_point_focus.description: Specialized split emphasizing a target muscle group 3-4 times per cycle with increased frequency and volume for rapid improvement.

split.frequencyLabel: How many days per week can you train?
split.frequencyDescription: This helps us optimize your split and volume distribution.

recommendations.label: Recommendation:
recommendations.low: Full Body split is ideal for 2 or fewer training days per week.
recommendations.three: Push/Pull/Legs or Full Body work well with 3 days per week.
recommendations.medium: Upper/Lower or Push/Pull/Legs provide optimal frequency and recovery.
recommendations.high: Push/Pull/Legs allows high frequency training with adequate recovery.

equipment.title: Equipment Preferences
equipment.description: Select all the equipment you have access to. The AI will use this to generate personalized workouts.

weakPoints.title: Identify Your Weak Points
weakPoints.description: Select up to 3 muscle groups that you want to prioritize. The AI will adjust workout volume and exercise selection accordingly.
weakPoints.optionalNote: This is optional - you can skip if you don't have specific weak points.

bodyMap.limitReachedMessage: Perfect! Focusing on fewer muscles gives better results.

point1.title: If everything is a priority, nothing is
point1.description: Trying to improve too many muscle groups at once spreads your recovery capacity thin and slows progress everywhere.

point2.title: Effective prioritization requires specific resources
point2.description: Each weak point needs increased frequency (2x/week vs 1x) and volume (+30-50% sets). You can only sustain this for 1-3 muscle groups.

point3.title: Recovery determines results
point3.description: Your nervous system and recovery capacity are limited. Focusing on 1-3 weak points allows proper progression while maintaining other muscle groups.

point4.title: Rotate priorities across mesocycles
point4.description: Work on 1-3 weak points per mesocycle (6-8 weeks), then rotate. Over time you'll address everything systematically.

strength.title: Strength Baseline
strength.description: Add your current strength levels for exercises you know. This helps the AI set appropriate starting weights.
strength.optional: This is optional - the AI can estimate starting weights if you skip this step.

addExercise.placeholder: Add exercise (e.g., Bench Press, Panca Piana, etc.)
addExercise.typeToSearch: Type to search or add custom exercise

emptyState.description: Use the search box above to add your first exercise

exerciseCard.validationError: Please fill in all fields for this exercise

tip.label: Tip:
tip.description: RIR (Reps in Reserve) indicates how many more reps you could have done. For example, RIR 1 means you stopped with 1 rep left in the tank.

profile.title: Your Profile (Optional)
profile.description: Help the AI personalize your training with better recommendations, strength standards, and insights.
profile.allOptional: All fields are optional - you can skip this entirely and the app will work great.

caloricPhase.title: Caloric Phase
caloricPhase.description: Your current nutritional phase influences workout volume, exercise selection, and rep ranges

bulk.name: Bulk
bulk.details: Optimizes for maximum muscle building with higher volume tolerance (+15-20% sets)

cut.name: Cut
cut.details: Prioritizes muscle preservation with strategic volume reduction (-15-20% sets) and high S:F exercises

maintenance.name: Maintenance
maintenance.details: Maintains muscle and strength with standard training approach

input.label: Specify your daily caloric {type} (optional)

help.bulk: Positive value for caloric surplus (e.g., +500 means eating 500 kcal above maintenance)
help.cut: Negative value for caloric deficit (e.g., -300 means eating 300 kcal below maintenance)

input.range: Leave empty if you prefer not to specify. Range: -1500 to +1500 kcal.

messages.phaseUpdated: Caloric phase updated to {phase}. Your next workout will reflect these changes.
messages.updateFailed: Failed to update caloric phase. Please try again.
messages.rangeError: Caloric intake must be between -1500 and +1500 kcal

caloricPhase.tip: üí° Tip: Switch phases when your nutrition goals change (e.g., starting a cut after a bulk season)

weakPoints.description: Identify muscle groups you want to prioritize (max 3)
weakPoints.limitReachedMessage: Perfect! Focusing on fewer muscles gives better results.

point1.title: If everything is a priority, nothing is
point1.description: Trying to improve too many muscle groups at once spreads your recovery capacity thin and slows progress everywhere.

point2.title: Effective prioritization requires specific resources
point2.description: Each weak point needs increased frequency (2x/week vs 1x) and volume (+30-50% sets). You can only sustain this for 1-3 muscle groups.

point3.title: Recovery determines results
point3.description: Your nervous system and recovery capacity are limited. Focusing on 1-3 weak points allows proper progression while maintaining other muscle groups.

point4.title: Rotate priorities across mesocycles
point4.description: Work on 1-3 weak points per mesocycle (6-8 weeks), then rotate. Over time you'll address everything systematically.

memory.title: Memory Dashboard
memory.subtitle: What Arvo has learned about you

cta.subtitle: Join athletes using AI-powered training. Complete your first AI-generated workout in minutes.

technical.privacyFirst: Your data is yours. Privacy-first design.

brand.tagline: AI-powered parametric training for serious athletes.

athletes.title: For Athletes & Bodybuilders
athletes.description: Competitive athletes who want championship-level programming without the tech details.

developers.title: For Tech-Savvy Athletes
developers.description: Tech enthusiasts who want to understand the AI and training science behind their workouts.

casual.title: For Casual Users & Beginners
casual.description: No complicated decisions. Just show up, follow the app, and grow stronger effortlessly.

methodologies.subtitle: Not generic interpretations. Complete methodology implementations.

kubaMethod.name: Kuba Method
kubaMethod.volumeAcronyms: MEV: Minimum Effective Volume ¬∑ MAV: Maximum Adaptive Volume ¬∑ MRV: Maximum Recoverable Volume

mentzerHIT.name: Mike Mentzer HIT

principles.sets: <mono>1-2 sets</mono> per exercise to absolute failure

mentzerHIT.philosophyQuote: "More is not better. Better is better. Train with absolute intensity, then allow full recovery for growth."

bottomNote.text: Training approaches are implemented as complete knowledge bases, not hardcoded rules. AI agents query these knowledge engines to make decisions with full methodological fidelity.

fst7.name: FST-7
fst7.creator: Hany Rambod
fst7.description: Fascia Stretch Training for extreme muscle pumps
fst7.configDescription: of fascia stretching protocols and pump techniques

principles.sevenSets: <mono>7 consecutive sets</mono> on final exercise per muscle group
principles.shortRest: Rest: <mono>30-45s</mono> only between sets to maintain pump
principles.hydration: Hydration: <bold>Critical</bold> - sip water between every set

fst7.philosophyQuote: "7 sets with short rest creates an extreme pump that stretches the fascia from within, potentially creating more space for muscle growth. Used by multiple Mr. Olympia champions including Phil Heath and Chris Bumstead."

y3t.name: Y3T (Yoda 3 Training)
y3t.creator: Neil Hill
y3t.configDescription: of weekly variation protocols and intensity techniques
y3t.philosophyQuote: "Systematic weekly variation prevents neural and muscular adaptation. The body never fully adapts because the stimulus constantly changes. After 9 weeks (3 complete cycles), rotate exercises for novelty."
y3t.usedBy: Used by: 4x Mr. Olympia Flex Wheeler

mountainDog.name: Mountain Dog Training
mountainDog.creator: John Meadows
mountainDog.configDescription: of phase protocols and intensity techniques

principles.fourPhases: <mono>4-phase structure:</mono> Pre-activation ‚Üí Explosive ‚Üí Supramax Pump ‚Üí Loaded Stretching
principles.chainsAndBands: Accommodating resistance: <bold>Chains & bands</bold> are fundamental, not optional
principles.noDeload: No programmed deloads for <mono>6-12 weeks</mono> (recovery via exercise rotation)
principles.loadedStretching: Loaded stretching: <mono>30-60s holds</mono> in lengthened positions under load

phases.phase1Detail: Joint prep, blood flow, mind-muscle connection

mountainDog.philosophyQuote: "Combines extreme metabolic stress with mechanical tension. Exercise rotation every 3-4 weeks prevents adaptation plateaus without sacrificing technical mastery. Requires strong work capacity and ability to push beyond typical failure points."

hero.painPoints: "What weight should I use next set?" ¬∑ "Am I overtraining?" ¬∑ "Is this exercise swap equivalent?"

description.main: 15 specialized AI agents. Real-time set-by-set progression. Learns your preferences automatically.
description.methods: Kuba Method & Mentzer HIT implemented with scientific fidelity.

technical.powered: Powered by GPT-5 reasoning models. Pattern detection. Biomechanical weight adjustments.

aiShowcase.subtitle: Not just random exercise suggestions. See real AI decisions with complete reasoning.

exerciseArchitect.title: Exercise Architect
exerciseArchitect.description: Architects your training using GPT-5 reasoning ¬∑ AI Agent

loadNavigator.title: Load Navigator
loadNavigator.description: Navigates your loads in real-time, set-by-set ¬∑ AI Agent

reasoning.point1: ‚úì Hit top of rep range (12) with RIR 1

realTimeRecalc.title: Real-Time Adaptation
realTimeRecalc.description: Recalculates after every set, not just at workout start ¬∑ AI Agent

reasoning.point3: ‚úì Adjustment: -2.5kg + wider rep range for safety

cycleIntelligence.title: Cycle Intelligence
cycleIntelligence.description: Learns from every cycle you complete ¬∑ AI Agent

reasoning.volume: ‚úì Volume reduced 10% after detecting declining readiness
reasoning.recovery: ‚úì Shorter, more frequent sessions to improve recovery
reasoning.balance: ‚úì Extra focus on chest/shoulders (under-trained last cycle)

safetyFirst.title: Safety-First: Insights Integration
safetyFirst.description: Every AI agent reads active insights and adapts automatically

footer.text: The system learns from your behavior and protects you automatically.

subtitle.main: Write naturally. AI extracts insights, preferences, and patterns automatically.
subtitle.tagline: Zero manual tagging. Just honest feedback.

step1.title: 1. You Write
step1.exampleNote: "Felt amazing on squats today, could've pushed heavier. Shoulder still bothering me on overhead press though. Might stick to landmine press for a while."
step1.footer: ‚úçÔ∏è Just your honest feedback, no structured format required

step3.title: 3. Auto-Adapts
step3.avoided: Avoided due to shoulder pain insight

realExample.title: Real-World Example: Multi-Entity Extraction
realExample.description: One note, multiple insights extracted simultaneously
realExample.inputNote: "Lower back felt tight after deadlifts, might need to deload next week. Cable rows felt phenomenal though, definitely prefer them over barbell rows. Mental readiness was low today (2/5), probably overtrained shoulders this week."
realExample.contextText: Timestamps, exercise names, load used, and RIR from the workout are automatically attached to each insight. The AI doesn't just parse text‚Äîit understands workout context.

footer.text: Write like you'd text a coach: "shoulder hurts", "loved this", "felt weak". The Pattern Scout agent handles extraction, confidence scoring, and automatic application. You just write honestly.

gymReady.subtitle: Not another app that fails when you need it most. Designed for real training environments.

wakeLock.title: Wake Lock
wakeLock.detail: No more unlocking your phone between sets. Screen stays active with Wake Lock API.

offlineSupport.title: Offline Support
offlineSupport.detail: All AI decisions run client-side. Full functionality without connectivity. Auto-sync when back online.

crashRecovery.title: Crash Recovery
crashRecovery.detail: localStorage persistence after every set. App crashes? Phone dies? Your workout is safe.

customEquipment.title: Custom Equipment
customEquipment.detail: Got a specialty machine? Custom cable attachment? Add it once, AI suggests exercises for it forever.

codeExample.title: Crash Recovery - localStorage Persistence
codeExample.subtitle: Every set is saved immediately. Zero data loss.

results.batteryDies: Phone battery dies mid-workout ‚Üí Resume exactly where you left
results.appCrash: App crashes during heavy set ‚Üí No data lost

scenario.label: Real-world scenario:
scenario.text: You're mid-squat set, phone battery hits 1%, dies. Charge it, open app ‚Üí "Resume workout from Set 3?" Everything restored.

gymReady.footer: These features aren't marketing bullet points. They're in production, battle-tested in real gyms with spotty WiFi and dying phones.

aiCoaching.subtitle: Real-time guidance, hydration monitoring, and voice coaching. Not just planning‚Äîactive support throughout your workout.

hydrationReminders.title: AI Hydration Advisor
hydrationReminders.detail: Science-backed reminders (400-800ml/hr) that adapt to exercise type. Smart warnings before heavy compound lifts to prevent nausea.

audioCoaching.title: Voice Coaching
audioCoaching.detail: Set-by-set voice cues generated by AI. Technical focus, mental preparation, rest timing‚Äîlike having a coach by your side.

quickActions.title: Quick Workout Actions
quickActions.detail: Add sets, swap exercises, adjust weights‚Äîall validated by AI in real-time. No interruptions to your training flow.

adaptivePlanning.title: Adaptive Split Planning
adaptivePlanning.description: Training plans that evolve with you ¬∑ AI Agent
adaptivePlanning.detail: Your next split learns from previous cycles. Volume, recovery, and muscle balance automatically optimized based on real performance data.

features.volumeOptimization: Progressive volume based on recovery trends

min15.label: 15 min in
min15.event: Hydration reminder: "200ml water - squats coming up"

min20.label: 20 min in
min20.event: Audio coach: "Next set, focus on controlled descent. 3-second eccentric. You've got this."

min25.label: Set 3 completed
min25.event: Small sips warning: "Heavy set ahead. Small sips only (50-100ml) to avoid nausea."

min30.label: Feeling knee pain
min30.event: Quick swap: Squat ‚Üí Bulgarian Split Squat (AI validates + adjusts weight to 63kg)

footer.bold: This is AI coaching done right.
footer.text: Not generic timers or static scripts. Real-time adaptation using GPT-5 reasoning, sports science, and biomechanical intelligence.

comparison.subtitle: No marketing claims. Just feature-by-feature comparison.

card.title: Feature Comparison
card.description: Arvo vs alternatives you're probably considering

bottomNote.label: The reality:
bottomNote.text: Excel gives you full control but zero intelligence. Generic apps track sets but don't understand progression. PTs are great but expensive and unavailable 24/7. Arvo combines AI reasoning with always-on availability at zero cost.

faq.title: Questions?
faq.subtitle: The 6 questions everyone asks before trying a new training app.

offline.question: Does it work offline in the gym?
offline.answer: Yes, completely. All AI decisions run locally with cached models. No internet required during workouts. Data syncs automatically when you're back online. Wake Lock keeps screen on, so you never have to unlock your phone between sets.

customEquipment.question: Can I add my own custom equipment?
customEquipment.answer: Absolutely. Got a specialty machine your gym has? Custom cable attachment? Add it once with a name and example exercises. The AI will suggest exercises for your custom equipment in future workouts. It's in the equipment database permanently.

injury.question: What if I get injured or have pain?
injury.answer: The Insights system automatically detects patterns. Log pain once on French Press? It notes it. Twice? Creates an insight with severity level. Three times? Automatically avoids that exercise and suggests alternatives. Every AI agent reads active insights and adapts decisions accordingly. Zero configuration required.

learning.question: How does the AI learn my preferences?
learning.answer: Three ways: 1) Pattern detection (you substitute Exercise A with B 3+ times ‚Üí learns preference), 2) Notes extraction (write 'loved this exercise' at end of workout ‚Üí creates positive memory with NLP), 3) Behavioral signals (consistently high mental readiness on certain movements ‚Üí confidence boost). All automatic, zero manual tagging. Just write honest feedback and the Pattern Scout agent extracts insights.

vsExcel.question: How is this different from an Excel spreadsheet?
vsExcel.answer: Excel gives you control but zero intelligence. You manually calculate next weight, track volume, decide when to deload. Arvo automates all of it with AI reasoning: set-by-set progression suggestions in <500ms, volume tracking vs MEV/MAV/MRV, automatic deload triggers, biomechanical weight adjustments for exercise swaps, pattern learning from your preferences. Excel is static. Arvo adapts.

dataOwnership.question: Is my training data mine? Can I export it?
dataOwnership.answer: 100% yours. Export anytime to JSON/CSV. Privacy-first design: no data selling, no third-party analytics tracking your workouts. Your training history belongs to you. Supabase backend with row-level security. You own your data completely.

pricing.question: How much does it cost?
pricing.answer: Free to start. Passwordless magic link authentication, no credit card required. Core features (AI workout generation, progression tracking, insights, custom equipment) are available immediately. The goal is to make intelligent training accessible, not to gatekeep behind paywalls.

contestPrep.question: Can I use this for contest prep?
contestPrep.answer: Absolutely. Track volume vs MRV week by week, monitor mental readiness trends across your prep, get automatic deload suggestions when fatigue accumulates. Everything you need for structured contest preparation with intelligent volume management.

periodization.question: Does it understand periodization?
periodization.answer: Yes. Kuba Method has accumulation/intensification/deload phases built in. Mentzer HIT has 4-7 day recovery protocols. The system tracks where you are in your training cycle and adjusts volume, intensity, and frequency accordingly. It's not just logging‚Äîit's intelligent periodization.

customPrograms.question: What if I want to run my own program?
customPrograms.answer: You're not locked into Kuba or Mentzer. Track any program you want. The AI still provides set-by-set progression guidance, injury pattern detection, volume tracking, and biomechanical adjustments. Use the intelligence layer with your own programming.

volumeTracking.subtitle: Never overtrain. Never undertrain. Automatic tracking vs scientific landmarks.

deloadCard.title: Automatic Deload Triggers
deloadCard.description: System detects fatigue patterns and suggests deloads before you overtrain

noProgress.example: Bench press stuck at 100kg √ó 10 for 3 workouts

intelligentPrevention.title: Intelligent prevention:
intelligentPrevention.description: The system tracks progress stalls, mental readiness trends, and volume accumulation. When multiple biomarkers suggest fatigue, it recommends a deload before performance degrades.

cycleComparison.title: Cycle-to-Cycle Progress Tracking
cycleComparison.description: See how each training cycle compares to the last

aiInsight.text: Higher volume with better recovery shows your capacity is increasing. Next cycle can push slightly harder while maintaining these recovery metrics.

comparisonNote.text: Generic apps count sets but don't understand MEV/MAV/MRV. Arvo tracks scientifically validated volume landmarks per muscle group and warns you before overtraining.

biomechanics.subtitle: Exercise substitutions with automatic weight adjustments based on biomechanics.

codeExample.title: Movement Adapter - Weight Calculation
codeExample.description: Biomechanical intelligence for exercise swaps ¬∑ AI Agent

proTip.label: Pro tip:
proTip.text: The system also validates if the substitution maintains workout intent. "Approved" means same stimulus-to-fatigue profile. "Caution" means different stimulus (with explanation).

equipmentVision.subtitle: Spotted an unusual machine at the gym? Just take a photo. AI recognizes it and suggests exercises instantly.

step1.title: 1. Take Photo
step1.description: Snap a picture of the equipment

benefits.title: Why This Matters
benefits.subtitle: Computer vision meets workout intelligence
benefits.point1Detail: Don't know the equipment name? Photo solves it
benefits.point2Detail: AI adds to database + suggests 3 exercises immediately
benefits.point3Detail: Every gym, every unusual machine, covered forever

useCase.title: Real-World Scenario:
useCase.description: You travel to a new gym. They have a unique cable machine you've never seen. Take photo ‚Üí AI identifies "Dual Adjustable Cable Crossover" ‚Üí Suggests Cable Flyes, Cable Rows, Pallof Press. Done.

footer.text: Visual equipment recognition + exercise suggestion is exclusive to Arvo. We're using GPT-4 Vision at the edge of fitness tech.

smartRestTimer.subtitle: Generic apps give you a fixed timer. Arvo adapts to your training methodology in real-time.

timerCard.title: Real-Time Rest Validation
timerCard.description: Color-coded feedback based on your approach + exercise type

optimal.label: üü¢ Optimal
optimal.message: Perfect rest for FST-7 hypertrophy stimulus

warning.label: üü° Warning
warning.message: Approaching upper limit - fascia stretch declining

methodologies.title: Approach-Aware Timing
methodologies.subtitle: Every methodology has different rest requirements

fst7.note: Final 7 sets require strict 30-45s for fascia stretch

y3t.note: Rest varies by week: Heavy (Week 1) needs more recovery

comparison.title: Generic Apps vs Arvo:
comparison.genericApps: Generic apps: Fixed 90s timer, regardless of methodology or exercise type. One-size-fits-all.
comparison.arvo: Arvo: Reads your approach, understands exercise biomechanics, validates rest in real-time with color coding. Smart adaptation.

footer.bold: Your rest timer has never been this intelligent.
footer.text: This isn't a countdown clock. It's a methodology-aware validation system that helps you train with scientific fidelity.

acceptance.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.paragraph1: By accessing and using Arvo ("the Service"), you accept and agree to be bound by the terms and provision of this agreement. If you do not agree to these Terms of Service, please do not use the Service.
acceptance.paragraph2: Arvo is operated by aetha.inc. These terms apply to all users of the Service.

description.title: 2. Description of Service
description.intro: Arvo is an AI-powered workout programming application that provides:

features.personalized: Personalized workout generation using artificial intelligence
features.methodology: Training methodology implementation (e.g., Kuba Method, Mentzer HIT)

description.important: IMPORTANT: The Service is for informational and educational purposes only. It is NOT medical advice, physical therapy, or professional coaching.

medical.title: 3. Medical Disclaimer
medical.warning: Arvo does not provide medical advice. Always consult with a qualified healthcare professional before starting any exercise program.
medical.aiLimitations: The AI-generated recommendations are based on general fitness principles and your input data. They cannot:

limitations.medical: Replace professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment
limitations.assess: Assess your specific health conditions or risk factors

medical.consultIf: You should consult a healthcare professional if you experience:

symptoms.pain: Persistent pain, discomfort, or unusual symptoms
symptoms.cardiovascular: Cardiovascular concerns (chest pain, dizziness, shortness of breath)
symptoms.doubt: Any doubt about your ability to safely perform an exercise

risk.title: 4. Assumption of Risk
risk.intro: Physical exercise involves inherent risks, including but not limited to:

risks.serious: Accidents resulting in serious injury or death

risk.acknowledgment: BY USING THIS SERVICE, YOU VOLUNTARILY ASSUME ALL RISKS associated with exercise and physical training. You acknowledge that you are solely responsible for:

responsibilities.fitness: Determining whether you are fit enough to perform suggested exercises
responsibilities.stopping: Stopping exercise if you feel pain, discomfort, or unusual symptoms

ai.title: 5. AI-Generated Content Limitations
ai.intro: Arvo uses artificial intelligence (AI) models to generate workout recommendations. You acknowledge and agree that:

limitations.algorithmic: AI recommendations are algorithmic outputs, not expert human judgment
limitations.errors: AI may make errors, suggest inappropriate exercises, or miscalculate loads
limitations.context: AI cannot fully understand context, nuance, or individual circumstances
limitations.evaluation: AI recommendations should be critically evaluated before implementation
limitations.validation: You are responsible for validating AI suggestions against your own knowledge and judgment

ai.disclaimer: We continuously improve our AI systems, but we cannot guarantee accuracy, completeness, or suitability of AI-generated content for your specific needs.

items.accurate: Provide accurate and complete information about your fitness level, limitations, and health status
items.update: Update your profile if your circumstances change (e.g., new injury, illness)
items.comply: Use the Service in accordance with these Terms
items.noMisuse: Not misuse or attempt to manipulate the AI systems
items.noShare: Not share your account credentials with others
items.laws: Comply with all applicable laws and regulations

privacy.title: 7. Privacy and Data Collection
privacy.intro: Your privacy is important to us. By using Arvo, you agree to our collection and use of your data as described in our

types.performance: Workout performance data (sets, reps, weights, RIR)

privacy.usage: This data is used to personalize your experience and improve AI recommendations. We do not sell your personal data to third parties.

liability.title: 8. Limitation of Liability
liability.warning: TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, AETHA.INC AND ITS AFFILIATES SHALL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY:

items.injuries: Injuries, illnesses, or deaths resulting from use of the Service
items.indirect: Indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages
items.loss: Loss of profits, data, or business opportunities
items.aiErrors: Damages arising from AI errors, inaccuracies, or omissions
items.reliance: Damages arising from reliance on Service content

liability.cap: Our total liability to you for any claims arising from use of the Service shall not exceed the amount you paid for the Service in the 12 months preceding the claim, or ‚Ç¨100, whichever is less.

indemnification.title: 9. Indemnification
indemnification.text: You agree to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless aetha.inc, its officers, directors, employees, and agents from any claims, damages, losses, liabilities, and expenses (including legal fees) arising from:

items.thirdParty: Your violation of any third-party rights
items.injuries: Any injuries or damages resulting from your exercise activities

age.title: 10. Age Restrictions
age.minimum: You must be at least 14 years old to use Arvo. Users under 18 should use the Service under parental supervision and with parental consent.
age.guardian: If you are under 18, your parent or legal guardian must review and accept these Terms on your behalf.

intellectual.title: 11. Intellectual Property
intellectual.ownership: All content, features, and functionality of the Service (including but not limited to text, graphics, logos, AI algorithms, and software) are owned by aetha.inc and are protected by international copyright, trademark, and other intellectual property laws.
intellectual.restrictions: You may not copy, modify, distribute, sell, or reverse-engineer any part of the Service without our explicit written permission.

attribution.title: 12. Training Methodology Attribution
attribution.methodology: Arvo implements training methodologies including the "Kuba Method" developed by Kuba Walczak. These methodologies are used with permission or under applicable licensing agreements.
attribution.acknowledgment: Users acknowledge that these methodologies are educational implementations and may differ from direct coaching by the original authors.

rights.modify: Modify or discontinue the Service at any time
rights.suspend: Suspend or terminate your account for violations of these Terms
rights.update: Update these Terms (we will notify you of material changes)

governing.title: 14. Governing Law
governing.text: These Terms are governed by the laws of Italy and the European Union. Any disputes shall be resolved in the courts of [Your Jurisdiction].

contact.title: 15. Contact Information
contact.intro: If you have questions about these Terms, please contact us at:

points.tool: Arvo is a fitness tool, not medical advice
points.risks: Exercise has risks - you assume them by using the Service
points.ai: AI can make mistakes - use critical judgment
points.age: You must be 14+ to use Arvo
points.privacy: We respect your privacy (see Privacy Policy)

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.metaDescription: Privacy Policy for Arvo - How we collect, use, and protect your data

intro.title: Your Privacy Matters
intro.paragraph1: Arvo is committed to protecting your privacy. This policy explains how we collect, use, store, and protect your personal information, including health data.
intro.paragraph2: We comply with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and applicable data protection laws.

account.title: 1.1 Account Information
account.intro: When you create an account, we collect:

health.title: 1.2 Health and Fitness Data (Special Category Data)
health.important: IMPORTANT: Under GDPR Article 9, health data is "special category" personal data requiring explicit consent and extra protection.
health.intro: We collect the following health-related data:

fitness.label: Fitness profile:
fitness.value: Training experience level, available equipment, training frequency

performance.label: Workout performance:
performance.value: Exercises performed, sets, reps, weights used, RIR (Reps In Reserve), rest times

pain.label: Pain and injury data:
pain.value: Reported limitations, pain locations, severity, affected exercises

notes.label: Workout notes:
notes.value: Free-text feedback including subjective feelings, fatigue, discomfort

composition.label: Body composition:
composition.value: (if provided) body fat percentage, muscle mass

items.device: Device information (browser, operating system, screen size)
items.ai: AI interaction patterns (e.g., workouts generated, exercises selected)
AI model providers for workout generation (data anonymized)

workout.label: Workout generation:
workout.value: AI uses your profile, history, and limitations to create personalized workouts

exercise.label: Exercise recommendations:
exercise.value: Selecting exercises based on equipment, experience, and preferences

progression.label: Progression tracking:
progression.value: Calculating appropriate weight/rep progressions based on performance

insights.label: Insight extraction:
insights.value: AI analyzes workout notes to detect patterns, preferences, and potential issues

safety.label: Safety features:
safety.value: Avoiding exercises that caused pain or injury

volume.label: Volume management:
volume.value: Tracking weekly volume to prevent overtraining

items.algorithms: Improving AI algorithms and recommendation accuracy
items.behavior: Understanding user behavior to enhance UX
items.features: Developing new features based on usage patterns

items.marketing: Marketing communications (only with your explicit consent)

items.compliance: Complying with legal requirements (e.g., tax, law enforcement)

legalBasis.title: 3. Legal Basis for Processing (GDPR)
legalBasis.intro: We process your data based on:

consent.label: Explicit consent (Article 9):
consent.value: For health data collection and AI processing

contract.label: Contract performance:
contract.value: To provide the Service you signed up for

legalBasis.withdrawal: You can withdraw your consent at any time by contacting us or deleting your account.

database.label: Primary database:
database.value: Supabase (PostgreSQL) hosted in EU data centers

items.rest: Encryption at rest for sensitive data
items.anonymization: Anonymization of data sent to AI providers

active.label: Active accounts:
active.value: As long as your account exists

deleted.label: Deleted accounts:
deleted.value: 30 days (to allow recovery), then permanently deleted

backups.label: Backups:
backups.value: Up to 90 days in encrypted backups

analytics.label: Anonymized analytics:
analytics.value: Indefinitely (cannot be linked back to you)

noSell.title: 5.1 We DO NOT Sell Your Data
noSell.text: We do not sell, rent, or trade your personal data to third parties for marketing purposes.

providers.title: 5.2 Service Providers
providers.intro: We share data with trusted service providers who help us operate:

items.ai: AI models (data anonymized, no PII sent)

providers.compliance: All service providers are bound by data processing agreements (DPAs) and comply with GDPR.

aiProcessing.title: 5.3 AI Model Processing
aiProcessing.intro: When generating workouts, we send anonymized data to AI providers (Anthropic, OpenAI). This data:

items.noPii: Does NOT include your name, email, or other identifying information
items.workoutOnly: Includes only workout-relevant data (exercise history, preferences, limitations)
items.noTraining: Is not used to train AI models (per provider agreements)
items.noStorage: Is not stored by AI providers beyond processing time

legalRequirements.title: 5.4 Legal Requirements
legalRequirements.intro: We may disclose your data if required by:

items.protection: Protection of our rights, safety, or property
items.prevention: Prevention of fraud or illegal activities

rights.title: 6. Your Rights (GDPR)

access.label: Access:
access.value: Request a copy of all personal data we hold about you

portability.label: Data portability:
portability.value: Receive your data in a structured, machine-readable format

restriction.label: Restriction:
restriction.value: Limit how we process your data

objection.label: Objection:
objection.value: Object to processing based on legitimate interests

withdraw.label: Withdraw consent:
withdraw.value: Revoke consent for health data processing at any time

complaint.label: Lodge a complaint:
complaint.value: File a complaint with a data protection authority

rights.contact: To exercise these rights, contact us at privacy@aetha.inc or use the settings page when available.

cookies.title: 7. Cookies and Tracking
cookies.intro: We use minimal cookies and tracking:

items.auth: Authentication tokens (to keep you logged in)

analytics.title: 7.2 Analytics Cookies (Optional)
analytics.disable: You can disable analytics cookies through your browser settings.

children.title: 8. Children's Privacy
children.paragraph1: Arvo is intended for users aged 14 and older. Users under 18 should use the Service under parental supervision.
children.paragraph2: We do not knowingly collect data from children under 14. If you believe we have collected such data, please contact us immediately, and we will delete it.

international.title: 9. International Data Transfers
international.intro: Your data is primarily stored and processed within the European Union. If data is transferred outside the EU (e.g., to AI providers in the US), we ensure adequate safeguards such as:

changes.title: 10. Changes to This Policy
changes.intro: We may update this Privacy Policy to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements. We will:

items.notify: Notify you of material changes via email or in-app notification
items.update: Update the "Last updated" date at the top
items.consent: Obtain your consent if required by law

changes.continued: Continued use of the Service after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated policy.

contact.title: 11. Contact Us
contact.intro: For privacy-related questions, data access requests, or to exercise your rights:
contact.euRepInfo: [To be determined if needed based on your business structure]

points.healthData: We collect health data to personalize your workouts (with your consent)
points.noSell: We DO NOT sell your data
points.secure: Data is stored securely in EU data centers
points.anonymized: AI providers receive anonymized data only
points.access: You can access, export, or delete your data anytime
points.gdpr: We comply with GDPR and take privacy seriously

medicalDisclaimer.title: Medical Disclaimer
medicalDisclaimer.metaDescription: Important medical disclaimer for Arvo - AI workout programming is not medical advice

onboarding.description: Before we generate your first AI-powered workout, please read this important safety information.
onboarding.emphasis: AI-generated workouts are educational tools, not medical advice or professional coaching.

medicalDisclaimer.consultProfessional: Always consult with a qualified healthcare professional before starting any exercise program.

aiCannot.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è AI Cannot:
items: Provide medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment

stopExercise.title: üö® Stop Exercise and Seek Medical Help If You Experience:
items: Chest pain, pressure, or difficulty breathing
Severe dizziness or loss of consciousness

responsibilities.title: ‚úÖ Your Responsibilities:
items: Obtain medical clearance before exercising (if needed)
Provide accurate information about your health and limitations
Stop if you experience pain, discomfort, or unusual symptoms
Critically evaluate AI recommendations using your own judgment

assumptionOfRisk.title: ‚öñÔ∏è Assumption of Risk:
assumptionOfRisk.description: Exercise involves inherent risks including muscle strains, joint injuries, cardiovascular events, and in rare cases, serious injury or death. By using Arvo, you voluntarily assume all risks associated with exercise and physical training.

medicalDisclaimer.consent: I have read and understood this medical disclaimer. I acknowledge that Arvo is not medical advice, that AI can make mistakes, and that I am solely responsible for my safety and health. I agree to consult healthcare professionals when appropriate.

page.subtitle: Important safety information - Please read carefully

criticalNotice.title: Critical Notice
criticalNotice.paragraph1: Arvo is NOT a medical device, healthcare provider, or substitute for professional medical advice.
criticalNotice.paragraph2: Always consult with a qualified healthcare professional before starting any exercise program, especially if you have pre-existing health conditions or concerns.

notMedicalAdvice.title: 1. Not Medical Advice
notMedicalAdvice.intro: The information, recommendations, and AI-generated workout programs provided by Arvo are for {strong}informational and educational purposes only{/strong}. They do NOT constitute:
notMedicalAdvice.warning: Arvo cannot and does not replace the expertise of qualified healthcare professionals, physical therapists, or certified personal trainers.

aiLimitations.title: 2. AI Limitations
aiLimitations.intro: Arvo uses artificial intelligence (AI) to generate workout recommendations. You must understand that:

aiCannot.title: AI Cannot:
aiCannot.assessMedical: {strong}Assess your medical condition:{/strong} AI cannot diagnose injuries, illnesses, or health problems
aiCannot.detectContraindications: {strong}Detect contraindications:{/strong} AI may not know about medications, conditions, or risk factors that make exercise dangerous for you
aiCannot.replaceClinical: {strong}Replace clinical judgment:{/strong} AI lacks the nuanced understanding of a medical professional
aiCannot.monitorRealtime: {strong}Monitor you in real-time:{/strong} AI cannot observe your form, fatigue, or distress during exercise
aiCannot.accountUnreported: {strong}Account for unreported conditions:{/strong} AI only knows what you explicitly tell it
aiCannot.guaranteeSafety: {strong}Guarantee safety:{/strong} AI recommendations may be inappropriate or dangerous for your specific situation

aiMistakes.title: AI Can Make Mistakes:
aiMistakes.unsafeExercises: Suggest exercises that are unsafe for you
aiMistakes.misinterpretPain: Misinterpret your feedback or pain reports
aiMistakes.causeInjury: Generate workouts that cause injury or overtraining
aiMistakes.incorrectCues: Provide incorrect technical cues or form instructions

aiLimitations.responsibility: YOU are responsible for critically evaluating all AI recommendations and using your own judgment.

whenConsult.title: 3. When to Consult a Healthcare Professional
whenConsult.intro: You MUST consult a qualified healthcare professional BEFORE using Arvo if you:

conditions.title: Have Any of These Conditions:
conditions.heart: Heart disease, cardiovascular conditions, or high blood pressure
conditions.diabetes: Diabetes or blood sugar regulation issues
conditions.joint: Joint problems, arthritis, or orthopedic conditions
conditions.other: Any other chronic or acute medical condition

medications.title: Are Taking Medications That May Affect Exercise:
medications.performance: Any medication that affects heart rate, blood pressure, or physical performance

over40.title: Are Over 40 and Sedentary:
over40.description: If you are over 40 years old and have been inactive for several months, get medical clearance before starting intense exercise.

familyHistory.title: Have Family History Of:
familyHistory.heartDisease: Heart disease or sudden cardiac death

stopAndSeek.title: 4. Stop Exercise and Seek Medical Help If You Experience:
stopAndSeek.emergencyIntro: STOP IMMEDIATELY and seek emergency medical care if you experience:

emergency.blurredVision: Blurred vision or loss of consciousness

stopAndSeek.consultFor: Also consult a healthcare professional for:

warning.jointPain: Joint pain that persists beyond normal muscle soreness
warning.sharpPain: Sharp or stabbing pain during or after exercise
warning.worseningPain: Pain that worsens over time or doesn't improve with rest

painTracking.title: 5. Pain and Injury Tracking Limitations
painTracking.warning: Arvo's pain and injury tracking features are NOT diagnostic tools.
painTracking.intro: When you report pain or limitations:

items.avoid: AI will attempt to avoid exercises that caused pain
items.cannotDiagnose: AI CANNOT diagnose the cause of your pain
items.cannotDetermine: AI CANNOT determine if exercise is safe for you
items.cannotProvide: AI CANNOT provide medical treatment recommendations

painTracking.conclusion: If you experience pain, consult a qualified healthcare professional (doctor, physical therapist, sports medicine specialist) for proper diagnosis and treatment.

exerciseRisks.title: 6. Exercise Risks
exerciseRisks.intro: Exercise and physical training carry inherent risks, including but not limited to:
exerciseRisks.acknowledgment: By using Arvo, you acknowledge these risks and voluntarily assume them.

items.medicalClearance: {strong}Medical clearance:{/strong} Obtaining approval from your doctor before exercising
items.honestDisclosure: {strong}Honest disclosure:{/strong} Providing accurate information about your health, limitations, and injuries
items.exerciseJudgment: {strong}Exercise judgment:{/strong} Evaluating whether AI recommendations are appropriate for you
items.properTechnique: {strong}Proper technique:{/strong} Learning and using correct form (consider hiring a qualified coach)
items.safeEnvironment: {strong}Safe environment:{/strong} Training in a safe space with proper equipment
items.progressiveOverload: {strong}Progressive overload:{/strong} Increasing intensity gradually and listening to your body
items.restRecovery: {strong}Rest and recovery:{/strong} Taking adequate rest days and addressing fatigue

noProfessionalRelationship.title: 8. No Professional Relationship
noProfessionalRelationship.paragraph1: Use of Arvo does NOT create a doctor-patient, therapist-client, or coach-athlete relationship. We do not have a duty of care toward you.
noProfessionalRelationship.paragraph2: You should not rely on Arvo as your sole source of fitness guidance. Consider working with:

professionals.trainer: A certified personal trainer (for technique and programming)
professionals.doctor: A sports medicine doctor (for injury prevention and management)

disclaimerWarranties.title: 9. Disclaimer of Warranties
disclaimerWarranties.warning: ARVO IS PROVIDED "AS IS" WITHOUT WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED.

items.goals: The Service will meet your fitness goals
items.accurate: AI recommendations are accurate, complete, or suitable for you
items.prevent: Use of the Service will prevent injuries
items.errorFree: The Service is error-free or uninterrupted

limitationLiability.title: 10. Limitation of Liability
limitationLiability.warning: TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, WE ARE NOT LIABLE FOR ANY INJURIES, ILLNESSES, OR DAMAGES RESULTING FROM YOUR USE OF ARVO.
limitationLiability.intro: This includes but is not limited to:

items.injuries: Injuries sustained while following AI-generated workouts
items.expenses: Medical expenses or loss of income
items.aiErrors: Any damages arising from AI errors or recommendations

limitationLiability.seeTerms: See our {link}Terms of Service{/link} for complete liability limitations.

commonSense.title: 11. Use Common Sense
commonSense.intro: Exercise requires judgment and common sense:

items.tooHeavy: If a weight feels too heavy, use less weight
items.unsureForm: If you're unsure about form, learn proper technique first
items.sickInjured: If you're sick, injured, or exhausted, REST
items.dangerous: If AI suggests something that seems dangerous, DON'T DO IT

commonSense.conclusion: Your safety is YOUR responsibility. AI cannot keep you safe‚Äîonly you can.

acknowledgment.title: 12. Acknowledgment
acknowledgment.paragraph1: By using Arvo, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to this Medical Disclaimer. You accept full responsibility for your health and safety while using the Service.
acknowledgment.paragraph2: If you do not accept these terms, do not use Arvo.

summary.title: Summary

items.tool: Arvo is a tool, not a doctor or coach
items.mistakes: AI can make mistakes‚Äîuse your judgment
items.stop: Stop if you feel pain or distress
items.assume: You assume all risks of exercise
items.notLiable: We are not liable for injuries

summary.conclusion: Exercise smart. Stay safe. Consult professionals when in doubt.

hero.painPoints: "What progression should I use?" ¬∑ "Am I pushing too hard?" ¬∑ "How do I structure my mesocycle?"

description.main: Intelligent coaching systems that understand progressive overload, periodization, and recovery. Built for serious athletes.
description.methods: Complete Kuba Method and Mentzer HIT implementations, not simplified versions.

technical.science: Built on training science: MEV/MAV/MRV volume tracking, tempo prescriptions, intelligent periodization.

coachingShowcase.subtitle: Not generic workout tracking. Specialized coaching intelligence that understands your training goals.

scenario.situation: You mention upper chest needs work in your profile.
scenario.response: Every chest session: Incline movements first, when you're fresh. Flat bench comes later. Upper chest gets priority stimulus until it catches up.

result.title: Result:
result.description: Your program adapts to fix imbalances, not just track generic "chest day" volume.

progressiveOverload.title: Progressive Overload, Automated
progressiveOverload.description: Load progression that respects your performance

scenario.situation: Set 1: 100kg √ó 12 reps @ RIR 1, feeling strong (mental readiness: 4/5)
scenario.response: Set 2: AI suggests 102.5kg √ó 8-10 reps. You hit top of range with good RIR? Weight goes up. Rep quality is your guide.

alternative.situation: Alternative scenario: Set 1 felt heavy, RIR was 3
alternative.response: Set 2: Weight stays at 100kg, target more reps (10-12). Or AI drops to 97.5kg to keep you in the stimulus zone.

result.title: Result:
result.description: No more guessing "should I add weight?" The system knows, based on your actual performance.

setAdaptation.title: Set-by-Set Adaptation
setAdaptation.description: Your next set changes based on how this one felt

scenario.situation: Planned: 3 sets of 100kg √ó 8-10. Set 1 is rough‚Äîyou hit only 8 reps @ RIR 3, mental readiness drops to 2/5.
scenario.response: Set 2 recalculates in real-time: drops to 97.5kg, wider rep range (8-12) for safety. Set 3 might drop further if needed.

result.title: Result:
result.description: The workout adapts to your actual state, not a pre-programmed plan that ignores fatigue.

cycleEvolution.title: Season-to-Season Evolution
cycleEvolution.description: Learns from every mesocycle you complete

scenario.situation: Last mesocycle: Your mental readiness averaged 2.8/5, volume climbed close to MRV by week 4, deload came late.
scenario.response: Next mesocycle: Volume starts lower, frequency drops from 6 to 5 sessions/week, extra focus on recovery. The system learned you were pushing too hard.

result.title: Result:
result.description: Every training block gets smarter based on real data from your previous cycles.

footer.text: not just workout logging. The system understands training principles and applies them to your actual performance.

problem.title: You Understand Training Science. You Need Intelligent Automation.
problem.description: You know MEV from MAV. You understand progressive overload. You don't need training explained‚Äîyou need a system that respects the science and automates the details.

excel.title: Excel Spreadsheets
excel.description: Manual calculations, no intelligence. You track everything but program nothing. Every mesocycle starts from scratch.

genericApps.title: Generic Apps
genericApps.description: "Track your sets!" Great. But they don't understand periodization, volume landmarks, or intelligent progression. Just fancy logs.

coaches.title: Online Coaches
coaches.description: Expensive. Not always available when you need guidance mid-workout. Can't adjust in real-time as your session unfolds.

solution.title: Arvo: Intelligent Programming That Understands Your Science
solution.description: Built for athletes who know training principles and need a system that applies them automatically, set by set, cycle by cycle.

methodology.title: Methodology Fidelity
methodology.description: Real Kuba Method. Complete Mentzer HIT. Not watered-down interpretations. Every principle implemented.

intelligence.title: Set-by-Set Intelligence
intelligence.description: Progressive overload calculated in real-time. Load adjustments based on RIR, mental readiness, and performance trends.

learning.title: Pattern Learning
learning.description: Remembers what works for YOUR body. Injury patterns, exercise preferences, volume tolerance‚Äîall tracked automatically.

title.appThinks: The app that thinks for you
title.subtitle: Always in your pocket

hero.painPoints: "I don't know what to do at the gym" ¬∑ "Apps are too complicated" ¬∑ "I don't see results"

description.main: Nothing to study. Nothing to decide. Just results.
description.sub: Answer 3 questions, the app creates everything. Then just lift.

technical.noScience: You don't need to know anything about training.
technical.promise: Just 3 minutes and you're at the gym.

simpleShowcase.subtitle: 3 steps and you're ready. Nothing to study.

step1.title: Answer 3 questions
step1.description: How many days do you want to train? What equipment do you have? Any pain or limitations?

step2.title: The app creates your program
step2.description: Advanced algorithms choose exercises, sets, reps, weights. You do nothing.

step3.title: Go to the gym and follow
step3.description: The app tells you exactly what to do. Automatic timer, calculated weights, guaranteed progression.

threeTapPlanning.title: 3 taps and you're ready
threeTapPlanning.subtitle: Less time than a coffee
threeTapPlanning.result: Complete program created. 0 decisions to make.

autoProgression.subtitle: You just lift. Progression is automatic.

explanation.what: Every week, the app tells you exactly how much weight to add.
explanation.why: It's called "progressive overload" - and it's the secret to growth.
explanation.how: The app calculates it for you. You don't have to think about anything.

autoProgression.cta: No calculations. No doubts. Just growth.

simpleResults.title: Real results
simpleResults.subtitle: Users who knew nothing about training. Now they have results.

testimonial2.quote: I never understood MEV, MAV, RIR... and I don't need to. The app does everything.
